I wanted to do a merge between a branch cvs to head.
I right clicked "Team-->Merge..." on my folder synchronized with HEAD.
And I got an error message "error refreshing tags" in a window.

Here is the trace from my .metadata/.log file

What CVS server version are you running? Also, could you follow the steps outlined in this URL to get a trace of the client/server communications? It would be very helpful in diagnosing the problem.

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-vcm-home/docs/online/cvs_features2.0/cvs-faq.html#misc_0

OK, I see the problem. The root of your project is a "virtual" directory. The Tag refresh is not recognizing that and hence is failing. The workaround is to go to the Configure Tags dialog and either manually configue the tags or pick another file to use as the auto-refresh file.

Where is the Configure Tags dialog? What is a auto-refresh file?
I don?t get what you said. Is there a piece of documentation somewhere?

Right beside the Refresh Tags button in the Merge wizard is a Configure Tags button that allows you to manually configure tags. The auto-refresh file can be set at the bottom of the Configure Tags dialog. There is a "Discovering branch and version tags" section in the help doc that describes this.
Fixed. We do not attempt to fetch the tags for the auto-refresh files if the target folder is a virtual directory.
